Posts.Content: Jul 22, 2011 07:20PM Haljen wrote: My husband is 36 years old and was diagnosed in february after having symptoms for about a year. He has a full right mastectomy on april 13, it was stage 1, grade 3 with an Oncotype of 12. His onc left it up to him as well! Due to the fact of his age and length of time he had symptoms without being treated he opted FOR the chemo. He is on his 3rd of 4 Taxotere/Cytoxen cocktails. He is going by the mentality of doing everything he possibly can to prevent reoccurrence. He will also be taking tomaxifen for 5 years after chemo. He has not had any neuropathy side effects. These drugs effect everyone differently.
Posts.Title: Chemo - since I have a choice, why would I? BobbiMarie Lee7

Posts.Content: Jul 7, 2011 06:56PM Haljen wrote: Jamie30. My husband had acne the first round. It's a side effect of the steroid. Hal takes decagon in pill form. They cut it back to the day before and the day of and the second round he didn't break out at all. Checking in after round 2. My husband had a much smoother round with SEs. They cut back the decahedron and no acne. They gave him a bladder protectant which adds 2 hours to the treatment time, but NO bladder issues this round! Woohoo! He has been forever scared from those visits with the urologist! They also spaced out the neupogen shots a bit differently and he had so much less severe joint and bone pain! been rinsing with baking soda and water morning and night and no mouth sores or sore throat, but taste buds are totally changing. Head I'd shaved and he's wearing a Yankee hat to work and dew rags at home when people come by to visit. Hair isn't all gone yet but very blotchy. His head is itchy but the onc said cortisone cream which seems to help.
Posts.Title: Taxotere/Cytoxan starting June 2011 vlnrph chickadee521

Posts.Content: Jul 12, 2011 07:01PM Haljen wrote: ewai-swimmer. . . I got my husband some spray cortisone and it seems to help with the itchy scalp. He did break out the first round but the adjusted the steroid and this ones been much better. Mrs Mot . . . Hal seems to have 1 emotional breakdown each round. Luckily it's at home. Hope you're feeling better! vtEllen . . . My husband only missed two days of work on his last round. First was tough due to side effects. I am presuming an extra day on the next round because last week was the holiday. He has his infusions on Wednesday's. Works thurs-Friday and recuperates over the weekend and only may miss a day or two of the next week. I think scheduling is key. Unfortunately with the time off from surgery and the many days for the first round of chemo they are starting to get on his case about making up hours! Anybody getting teary eyes? Seems to be the newest thing for him. He does stare at a computer all day. 1 more week until third infusion.

Posts.Content: Jun 25, 2011 06:22AM Haljen wrote: Update on urologist. Hal had a CT Scan and unfortunately a bladder scope which has now scarred him for life! He said the mastectomy was easier than the bladder scope! My poor hubby! Well, all that and they found NOTHING!!! Which I know is a good thing but he is pissed he had to go through such an invasive procedure for no reason! I know the docs are being overly cautious, I am pretty aggravated and sincerely hope they give him the bladder protectant regardless on his next treatment! He was supposed to have at least one good week before starting all over this Wednesday. He was also supposed to have something modified on his car that they screwed up! His car is his only outlet these days and he is just feeling beet down in all directions right now! ;(

Posts.Content: Sep 8, 2011 06:21PM Haljen wrote: Hal is having his port out on Saturday and cleared for tomaxifen on Monday. The onc said the most common side effect in men are the hot flashes. We shall see . . .
Posts.Title: Taxotere/Cytoxan starting June 2011 vlnrph chickadee521

Posts.Content: Jul 22, 2011 07:42PM Haljen wrote: My husband had his third treatment this past Wednesday. He has been working through the best he can. The first round was the worst so far with SE. They have adjusted his meds to help the SE's a bit and the second round he only missed 2 days in the 3 week period. This round he may miss 3 days. He has treatment on a Wednesday. Works thurs-fri and has the weekend to crash. He gets a neupogen shot on Sunday and Tuesday, so he may miss work mon-tues. Those shots really mess him up with bone pain. Because he had a long recovery not working from the mastectomy his job really got on his back about working longer hours on his good days so he has been doing 11 hour days when he can. I really wish they were a little more sympathetic as rest is a big part of healing and I feel he is burning himself out.
Posts.Title: Poll: How many ladies worked through Chemo? Chrys23 Chrys23

Posts.Content: Jun 14, 2011 06:08PM Haljen wrote: Hal had a soar throat, seems to be getting better slightly. He's been rinsing with baking soda + water, Onc said it was normal from the chemo, but definitely mention it. I've got my little black book with a list of his side effects. I even tried the claritan and ibuprofen for the pain, he has been getting a little relief. I sure hope they don't give him another shot in the office tomorrow is his 1 week follow up. . . . Maybe they will cut back the steroids because of the acne and change his cocktail a bit? I think they over compensated for his height and weight? But hey I'm not a doc. I don't know other couples going through this. There is another woman that has joined the forum recently and i am going to check out her threads. I believe her husbands surgery is at the end of June and I'd love to answer any questions she has or offer advice to her. Someone just bumped a post for me to see and I was headed there next! (((((Hugs)))))
Posts.Title: Taxotere/Cytoxan starting June 2011 vlnrph chickadee521

Posts.Content: Jun 16, 2011 06:32PM Haljen wrote: Unbearable pain last night from the third neupogen shot! The claratin and ibuprofen are useless to Hals pain! :( Saw the onc today just to chat. There is a new game plan. We are waiting on some tests from the urologist because Hal had some blood and discomfort during urination. The onc believes it may be from the Cytoxen. He may be adding a bladder protectant in his cocktail. He will be cutting back to two neupogen shots and spacing them out differently. The steroid will also not be taken the day after due to the acne.

Posts.Content: Jun 13, 2011 05:10PM Haljen wrote: My husband started TCx4 every 3 weeks on June 8th. He hasn't had much nausea due to the combination of anti-nausea medications they had him on. He was extremely fatigued this past weekend. He isn't getting the neulasta shot in the office, we opted for the neupogen at home. His first shot was this past Saturday and the second one was today. He has been having Extreme joint/bone pain! Saw the onc today due to blood in the urine along with pain. He was put on antibiotics and will see a urologist on Thursday. Also breaking out from the steroids and a little bit of a sore throat.

Posts.Content: Jun 14, 2011 09:26PM Haljen wrote: Designermom - I found the thread! Thanks! Everyone is so helpful! There has been so much thrown at you all at once that I may have missed the onc mentioning to call about a fever, but I monitored it closely and gave him Tylenol and it was gone in a few hours. But . . . He woke the next day with blood in urine and with discomfort. Went to the onc in AM to check it out, got antibiotics.. Seeing onc tomorrow and urologist if necessary on Thursday. Hope all goes well tomorrow! Kittycat - we had a visit yesterday to the onc and his WBC count was fine but he wanted him to take the second shot regardless yesterday, the aches and pIns continue. I've been giving him claratin and ibuprofen, he gets some relief. He rested for a few days and tried to go to work today but couldn't focus and went home. I told him he should try at home first and he can rest in between when he gets tired. He is a graphic designer and it's hard to be creative. Thanks for the info on the beets. I'll have to try them out. I don't know if either of us like them, but I will add it to the rotation and test it out. I recently discovered yams! Yum,

Posts.Content: Jun 16, 2011 09:27PM Haljen wrote: JFV-Hal is seeing Dr. Citron at Pr Health in Lake Success. He is drink drink drinking! Lol! I have an alarm go off on his phone periodically and th PA at the Onc's office got a kick out of it when it went off during his follow up! He is going to try to go to work tomorrow, we'll see how it goes. We has a talk with the onc today, pending a few test with the urologist, the onc plans on keeping the chemo at the same level and adding a bladder protectant to his cocktail, dropping the amount of steroid due to the acne, dropping the quantity of the neupogen shot and spacing them out differently. Last night he was in unbearable pain, it was so hard to see him that way, my poor baby! :(. The Claratin and IBuprofen are pretty much useless for his pain!

Posts.Content: Haljen wrote: Hello all! My husband was diagnosed Feb 2011, had a full right mastectomy April 2011 and just started chemo this past Wednesday. I am hoping to get some feedback from your experiences. So far he has had normal side effects. This morning he has started to get joint aches and this evening was his first neupogen shot. We noticed a red rash at his port site this afternoon. He also mentioned the sides if his tongue feel weird. Any advice? I get lots of advice from others on different treatments for different cancers and from other caregivers, but would love to hear feedback from people getting the same 'cocktail'. Love and support to you all!!!!! Dx 2/2011, IDC, 2cm, Stage I, Grade 3, 0/2 nodes, ER+/PR+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Husband started Taxotere/Cytoxen June 2011 Haljen Haljen

Posts.Content: Jun 12, 2011 06:55PM Haljen wrote: Thank you all for the great advice! The onc called today to check on him, I thought that was awesome! He is such a great doc! Even hand served us lunch the day of Chemo! :) He just started to run a fever, I gave him some Tylenol and will check his temp regularly! If it persists throughout the night do you think I should take him to the hospital? All we eat is chicken chicken chicken! Lol! So I am hoping he is getting enough protien, I know it is extremely importent through the treatment. His mother bought me the Eating Well Through Cancer Cookbook, and I am carrying it with me like a bible! I have timers go off on his cell phone every 1.5-2 hours to remind him to drink! It is extremely helpful since he isn't always thinking of drinking! I have him rinsing with a baking soda/water mixture as the nurse recommended. He does have a sore throat but the doc said that was normal from the chemo, maybe I should add the salt to it too? I am cooking every night for him, I am too scared to order out or at this point even have him leave the house until his blood work is done on Wednesday. His boss expects him to come to work, I just emailed him telling him it may not be possible tomorrow. Just taking it one day at a time as his side effects are different every day. Again thank you all for the advice it is extremely appreciated!
Posts.Title: Husband started Taxotere/Cytoxen June 2011 Haljen Haljen
